title: Funnest Champion?
body:
Who are the funnest champions in your opinion?

If you can, try to stay away from your regular mains :D

Mine would be Ahri and Gragas, it's nice to dash around every now and then or to just bellyflop your way through things xD

replies.body: Zilean. Zoomzoom speeds, really irritating for the enemy team. Bombs are just SOOOO fun.

lvl7 Zilean support mains 4life. Enemy team is about to get a kill? denied. Your about to die against that assassin? nope you still keep a perfect score. Enemy team tried to group up? stunlocks. Enemy trying to run away? How do you like 99% slow and speedups. Bush strats? Bomb facecheck and you take damage instead.

The funniest champion that I have ever used is Ziggs, although I don't own him at the moment.
His actions are somehow quite funny, like he threw bombs and things at his opponents, and his voice sounds funny as well.
Playing Galio is funny to me, because i can tank towers with my W
For me it will forever be the king of the court himself {{champion:122}} you can never get tired if dunking people

Riven for me! :D Yes I am a Riven main however, she takes alot of mechanical skill with her combos and animation cancels. The plays she makes are awesome and she is such a fun champion because she takes skill to use :)

and then somebody counterpicks you with garen and he beats your mechanical skill and mastery with spinning around in circles and then a giant sword of true damage because you know this game is all about skill.
You can hate on Garen all you want but to beat a good riven (or any champion for that matter) that knows their limits does take skill.

I don't hate on garen at all. I'm sorry I sounded that way, I just think it's hilarious how much of a nuisance he can become if he knows how to play the map and when to engage. He doesn't require mechanics and I think it's funny when he just goes ham and you're silenced and you just have to take his spinning and just be like 'well I didn't want to use my combo anyways'. 

 That said a champion I used to play alot and still do sometimes; cho'gath is in my opinion the pinnacle of not being good and still being able to destroy people who master highskillcap champions. Mastery 7 Yasou? hahahahahaha I picked cho'gath you aren't going to have a good time. He's deadlevel easy, with huge sustain, naturally super tanky, massive sustained melee damage, ranged poke, a knockup and silence, huge true damage, high ap ratios but also high base damage. I have mastery 5 almost 6 in cho'gath and imo there is no difference between playing him first time and mastering him, you'll still do well.
Also good waveclear and even if you are completely outmatched in lane nobody wants to towerdive you.

I have no problem with riven mains so long as they look at their map, maybe roam and ping mias, since they often are strong enough to end the game before the teamfight heavy lategame if they get ahead; and I feel riven mains aren't as toxic as they might have been in the past.

I generally don't have any problem with any main though so long as you aren't super toxic...except for lvl7 teemo's who lose lane to nasus even though I camped top and who try to convince me that teemo is countered by nasus even though I played teemo for a fairly long time and I don't see how you can lose that lane.
I agree! Positivity all the way :D
I know what I am doing with Riven, I know who to respect and who to go ham on. The more you play your main, the more experience you will gain with every matchup so you know what do to everytime :)
It all depends on the player! :)

trynd is fun. right click. right click again. repeat. win game. fun
Ummm, I main Leblanc, and she is sooooo broken, definitely recommend her :)
I enjoy playing sion lately having never played him post rework and everytime i ult im like choo choo muthafuckas.
